info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN CHAMPAIGN, WESTERN CLARK, NORTHWESTERN GREENE, NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND EASTERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Troy, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Springfield, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Troy, Vandalia, Tipp City, New Carlisle, Wright-Patterson Afb, Northridge, Enon, St. Paris, Fletcher, Tremont City, Donnelsville and Casstown. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 37 and 53. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 65 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
